required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-Label Study Examining the Long-Term Safety of Exenatide Given Twice Daily to Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study Examining the Long-Term Safety of Exenatide Given Twice Daily to Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess the long-term safety of exenatide in patients with type 2 diabetes who were treated with exenatide in Study H8O-MC-GWAA (6-month study) or Study H8O-MC-GWAD (12-month study). Study H8O-MC-GWAN serves as an open-ended extension to Studies H8O-MC-GWAA and H8O-MC-GWAD.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety of twice-daily exenatide treatment, as defined by the occurrence of adverse events.
primary_outcome.description: Visits for this study occur at 6-mo (Â±2 wk) intervals until exenatide is approved for marketing.

arm_group.description: Exenatide injection 5mcg or 10 mcg, twice daily

intervention.description: subcutaneous injection, 5mcg or 10 mcg, twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients received exenatide therapy in Study H8O-MC-GWAA or Study H8O-MC-GWAD and completed the respective study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded or discontinued early from Study H8O-MC-GWAA or Study H8O-MC-GWAD.
- Patients have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug, not including exenatide, that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.
